article.title_short: Being curiouser and curiouser about AdWords
article.title_long: Being curiouser and curiouser about AdWords
article.author: Nick
article.body_1: The key word is curiosity.  It doesn't matter if you are a marketing maven, a digital deity or a technical demi-god at some point you will need to consider driving strategic traffic to your little corner of the web.  Which brings me to my point.  No matter your role you’ll want to know enough to intelligently discuss AdWords campaigns.  Sure, the high level concepts are simple enough but the practical application requires uncommon sense.
article.body_2: -I-Here’s the part where I give free (priceless) advice-E-
article.body_3: Take the time to learn enough about AdWords and analytics to apply it to your current job task and maybe some future tasks as well.  Google has what I consider to be one of the best free certification processes for learning and proving knowledge of this discipline. You’ll need to pass two of the AdWords certification exams to become an AdWords certified professional.  The first is the AdWords Fundamentals exam, then one of the following: Search Advertising, Display Advertising, Mobile Advertising, Video Advertising, or Shopping Advertising.
article.body_4: I was asked by two separate startups to -DQ-get smart-DQ- with AdWords.  Later while creating content for an e-commerce gig I was again asked to provide some AdWords insight.  It seems like the secret skill set that everyone needs.--- -B-Get curious about AdWords and be in demand.-E-
